prov:Plan.rdfs:label: Recipe for Gates Data
prov:Plan.rdfs:commment: Recipe document: Documentation on Recipe for Gates Data

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Data Gathering
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Workflow Phase 0

ns0:program.rdfs:label: Load Test Dataset
ns0:program.rdfs:comment: Loading of initial matrix (output of YenerTensor.m)

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Data Processing
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Workflow Phase 1

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Adjust APGAR Scores
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Ensure APGAR scores are between 0-10
MATLAB code: YenerTensor.m, Section 1

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Choose subjects with all five time points
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Choose only subjects with all five time points
MATLAB code: YenerTensor.m, Section 1

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Imputation
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Impute or remove missing values based on how many are missing
Use regression model to impute for one missing time point
Use linear fit to impute for two missing_time_points
Remove subjects with more than two missing time points

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Weights, Heights
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Finds how many values are missing: If that is one, then fits a linear and quadratic regression on the remaining data. The fit with the higher R2 is used. If that is two, then fits a linear regression on the remaining data. If that is three, then the subject is removed.
MATLAB Code: YenerTensor.m, Section 4

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: BMI
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Calculates BMI from the values for each subject using the formula: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Body_mass_index
MATLAB Code: YenerTensor.m, Section 4

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: baz, haz, waz
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Calculates BAZ, HAZ, and WAZ from the imputed values based on WHO standards
MATLAB Code: Macros to calculate this using SAS, R, or STATA can be found here: http://www.who.int/childgrowth/software/en/

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Characteristic Data
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Get either the mean or mode (depending on the type of characteristic data) based on the 10 most similar subjects based on height and weight
MATLAB Code: YenerTensor.m, Section 8

ns0:Progam.rdfs:label: Normalization
ns0:Progam.rdfs:comment: For growth data, go through each subject and subtract the mean and standard deviation for each growth characteristic to normalize.
For characteristic data, go through each column and subtract by the mean and standard deviation of that column.

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Flag SGA Kids
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Identify subjects that are small for gestational age (SGA)
Gets the SGA status of each unique subject, calculated using birth WAZ in the less than 10th percentile

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Creating PARAFAC Model
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Workflow Phase 2

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Generate PARAFAC Model
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Create a PARAFAC model for the data using the N-Way toolbox
MATLAB code: TensorExplorationPARAFAC.m, Sections 7 and 8

ns0:Visualization.rdfs:label: PARAFAC Plot 1
ns0:Visualization.rdfs:comment: Scree-Plot for PARAFAC model
Create a PARAFAC model for the data using the N-Way toolbox and calculate the sum of squared errors, then plots it for each number of model components versus the sum of squared errors
MATLAB code: TensorExplorationPARAFAC.m, Section 7

ns0:Visualization.rdfs:label: PARAFAC Plot 2
ns0:Visualization.rdfs:comment: Core Consistency Plot (CORCONDIA)

If the CORCONDIA number is high (close to 100%), then PARAFAC model is valid; If the CORCONDIA number is mid-range (around 50%), the PARAFAC model should be reconsidered, perhaps with more constraints; If the CORCONDIA number is low (close to 0%), the PARAFAC model is not valid.
MATLAB code: TensorExplorationPARAFAC.m, Section 7

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Exploratory Analysis
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Workflow Phase 3

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Generate Plots
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Generate plots for exploratory analysis

ns0:Visualization.rdfs:label: Exploratory Analysis Plot 1
ns0:Visualization.rdfs:comment: Create a 3D plot for each time point for the original data, the modeled data, and the residuals
Create mesh plots for each time point based on the original tensor, the modeled data by PARAFAC, and the residual (original data â€“ modeled data), respectively

ns0:Visualization.rdfs:label: Exploratory Analysis Plot 2
ns0:Visualization.rdfs:comment: Create a plot of the loadings for each component in each mode to see which features, subjects, and time points are more important in their components and respective modes
MATLAB code: TensorExplorationPARAFAC.m, Section 11

ns0:Visualization.rdfs:label: Exploratory Analysis Plot 3
ns0:Visualization.rdfs:comment: Create a plot of the scores for each mode to see where each point falls
MATLAB code: TensorExplorationPARAFAC.m, Section 12

ns0:Visualization.rdfs:label: Exploratory Analysis Plot 4
ns0:Visualization.rdfs:comment: Create a gradient for each of the characteristics by their number values on the score plot for subjects
MATLAB code: TensorExplorationPARAFAC.m, Section 13

ns0:Visualization.rdfs:label: Exploratory Analysis Plot 5
ns0:Visualization.rdfs:comment: Create a plot of the scores colored by SGA to see where they
MATLAB code: TensorExplorationPARAFAC.m, Section 14

ns0:Visualization.rdfs:label: Exploratory Analysis Plot 6
ns0:Visualization.rdfs:comment: Create a heat map for each mode to see where scores in each plot relative to each other
MATLAB code: TensorExplorationPARAFAC.m, Section 15

ns0:Visualization.rdfs:label: Exploratory Analysis Plot 7
ns0:Visualization.rdfs:comment: Create a plot that shows the characteristics versus the more important component, depending on the results of the PARAFAC model.
MATLAB code: TensorExplorationPARAFAC.m, Section 23

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Clustering
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Workflow Phase 4

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Fuzzy C Means Clustering
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Cluster the subjects by the first mode of the modeled PARAFAC tensor using Fuzzy C-Means clustering

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Create IQ Histogram
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Create a histogram to look at the distributions of characteristics, especially IQ, for each cluster

ns0:Visualization.rdfs:label: IQ Histogram
ns0:Visualization.rdfs:comment: Histogram of distributions of characteristics, especially IQ, for each cluster

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Determine Characteristics of Clusters
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: Find the characteristics of each cluster by finding the means for each characteristic and testing whether these results are significant at 95% level

ns0:Program.rdfs:label: Create IQ PARAFAC Score Plot
ns0:Program.rdfs:comment: PARAFAC scores colored by each cluster to see where each cluster lies

ns0:Visualization.rdfs:label: PARAFAC Score Plot
ns0:Visualization.rdfs:comment: PARAFAC scores colored by each cluster to see where each cluster lies

ns0:Progam.rdfs:label: Determine significant data
Significant Data
ns0:Progam.rdfs:comment: After running tensor through analysis, use discretion as to which columns of data to include
